body_content.explanation: (of tissue or an organ in the body) having atrophied (= become smaller or thinner and weaker):
examples: These changes were more noticeable in the atrophic right kidney than in the left kidney.
The mucosa of the stomach was atrophic.

body_content.explanation: (of a disease or condition) relating to tissue or an organ in the body that becomes smaller or thinner and weaker:
examples: High salt intake can induce atrophic gastritis, a chronic inflammation and thinning of the stomach lining.
Atrophic rhinitis is nasal dryness that occurs when tissue inside of your nose thins or atrophies.
